title: Extinction and Fear Research
description:
This module takes an in-depth look at extinction,
recovery from extinction, and methods for reducing
recovery from extinction. It will investigate these topics
within the context of fear conditioning with the
translational focus on phobias and other anxiety
disorders. This class will discuss the theories that
explain these phenomena, with a particular focus on
Bouton’s theory, and the research that has investigated
these topics. Animal and human research from
behavioral, experimental psychopathology, and
behavioral neuroscience will be used to guide the
discussions.
prerequisite:
Completed 80 MCs of which student must have passed
PL1101E, PL2131, PL2132 and 4 of the 5 core modules
(PL3232/PL3102 - PL3236/PL3106), which should
include PL3232/PL3102 and PL3236/PL3106, with a
minimum CAP of 3.20 or be on the Honours track.
While it is not a pre-requisite, students are encouraged
to take PL3248 prior to taking this module.
